issue_description: All organizational meetings resulting from corporate procedures and agile methodology work. This includes both recurring and one-time meetings, whether they are company-wide or team-specific, and those organized within a dedicated group. This encompasses various meetings such as Increment demo, Micro-Front-Test checkpoints, Daily stand-ups, Retrospectives, and one-on-one sessions. Note: this does not apply to technical meetings related to the analysis and refinement of specific tasks, as time spent on those should be logged under the respective tasks.

All organizational meetings resulting from corporate procedures and agile methodology work. This includes both recurring and one-time meetings, whether they are company-wide or team-specific, and those organized within a dedicated group. This encompasses various meetings such as Increment demo, Micro-Front-Test checkpoints, Daily stand-ups, Retrospectives, and one-on-one sessions. SummaryThe task involves migrating CallPay's authentication method from Basic Auth to token-based authentication (v2) before the deadline of October 1st, 2025. This migration requires contacting each client due to the need for different configuration values. The goal is to ensure a seamless transition by implementing a temporary variable to handle both authentication methods during the migration period.ContextCallPay is transitioning its authentication method from Basic Auth to a token-based system. The sunset date for Basic Auth is October 1st, 2025, after which only token-based authentication will be supported. The migration involves changing API endpoints from /v1 to /v2 and requires new configuration values (OrgId and Salt). The integration must support both authentication methods until all clients are migrated.Acceptance criteriaImplement a temporary variable Version=2 to switch to token-based authentication.Ensure the integration supports both Basic Auth and token-based authentication until migration is complete.Update API endpoints to /v2 for all relevant requests.Remove Basic Auth and add necessary headers (Auth-Token, Org-Id, Timestamp) when Version=2 is set.Generate Auth-Token using OrgId, Salt, and a Unix timestamp.Complete migration of all clients before October 1st, 2025.Remove the temporary variable and discontinue Basic Auth after migration.Other informationAnalysis and further details can be found here: CallPay Migration to v2.Postman resources and official documentation are available for reference.The Jira Epic related to this task is CONN-395.Example code for generating the Auth-Token is provided in the documentation.Support task to obtain Salt and OrdId from all Callpay clients: #570237

SummaryThe task involves integrating Cloudbeds Property Management System (PMS) with our system through their channel manager, MyAllocator. This integration will facilitate the management of reservations, rates, and availability updates between the two systems.ContextCloudbeds is a PMS that connects with MyAllocator, a channel manager. The integration will require both push and pull methods for reservations to ensure data consistency and reliability. This is crucial for handling booking statuses, multi-room bookings, and various pricing models. The integration will also involve setting up authentication using a shared secret, username, and password unique to each hotel.Acceptance criteriaImplement push and pull methods for reservations, including new bookings, modifications, and cancellations.Support multi-room bookings and handle daily and total amounts, including gross amounts.Implement ARI (Availability, Rates, and Inventory) updates, including room-based and occupancy-based pricing.Ensure all requests include a secret_key, username, password, and property ID.Implement the following reservation features:Booking status updates for new, modified, and canceled bookings.Support for guest counts, including adults and children.Handle profiles for bookers, guests, companies, and travel agents.Include credit card details and comments/requests in reservations.Manage extras, deposits, loyalty details, corporate connect profiles, and vouchers.Ensure metadata import for room types and rate plans, with error handling for rate plan conflicts.Conduct HealthCheck and SetupProperty calls to verify credentials and system communication.Other informationAnalysis document: Cloudbeds API AnalysisPostman collection: [PMS] CloudBeds - MyAllocatorOfficial documentation: Myallocator GitHubJira Epic: PCONN-62Extranet access URL: https://inbox.myallocator.com/en/loginBase URLs for live environments:ARI: https://pms.profitroom.net/cloudbeds/<action>Reservations (push): https://api.myallocator.com/callback/ota/pro/v202203/<action>
